an9.25:4.1: “Mendicants, when a mendicant’s mind has been well consolidated with wisdom it’s appropriate for them to say:
an9.25:4.2: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
an9.25:5.1: And how is a mendicant’s mind well consolidated with wisdom?
an9.25:5.2: The mind is well consolidated with wisdom when they know: ‘My mind is without greed.’
an9.25:5.5: … ‘My mind is not liable to become greedy.’
an9.25:5.6: … ‘My mind is not liable to become hateful.’
an9.25:5.7: … ‘My mind is not liable to become deluded.’
an9.25:5.8: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the sensual realm.’
an9.25:5.9: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the realm of luminous form.’
an9.25:5.10: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the formless realm.’
an9.25:5.11: When a mendicant’s mind has been well consolidated with wisdom it’s appropriate for them to say:
an9.25:5.12: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’
